title: 2015 Mock AIME I Problem 1: Picking Numbers from a Hat
body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"David, Justin, Richard, and Palmer are demonstrating a \"math magic'' concept in front of an audience.  There are four boxes, labeled A, B, C, and D, and each one contains a different number.  First, David pulls out the numbers in boxes A and B and reports that their product is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"14"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":".  Justin then claims that the product of the numbers in boxes B and C is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"16"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", and Richard states the product of the numbers in boxes C and D to be "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"18"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":".  Finally, Palmer announces the product of the numbers in boxes D and A.  If "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"k"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is the number that Palmer says, what is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"20k"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"?"}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"We have
AB = 14,
BC = 16, and
CD = 18."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Multiplying the first and third equations gives us "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"ABCD = 252"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", while multiplying all three equations gives us "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"A(B^{2})(C^{2})D = 252  \times 16"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Therefore, we can say that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"252^{2}  = 252  \times 16AB"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":".  Solving the equation gets us "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"AB = 63/4"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", so "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"20AB"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\boxed{315}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

title: 2015 Mock AIME I Problem 2: Logarithm System
body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Suppose that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"y"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" are real numbers such that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\\log_x 3y = \\frac{20}{13}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\\log_{3x}y=\\frac23"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":".  The value of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\\log_{3x}3y"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" can be expressed in the form "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\\frac ab"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" where "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"b"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" are positive relatively prime integers.  Find "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a+b"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" \log _{3x} { 3y } =  \log _{3x} { 3 }  + \log _{3x} { y } "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Since "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\log _{3x} { y } = \frac {2} {3}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is given, we only need to find "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\log _{3x} { 3 } "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"From:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\log _{x} { 3y } = \frac {20}{13} \quad \Rightarrow 3y = x ^ {  \frac {20}{13} }"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\log _{3x} { y } = \frac {2}{3} \quad \Rightarrow y = (3x) ^ { \frac {2}{3} } \quad \Rightarrow 3y = 3 (3x) ^ { \frac {2}{3} } "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\Rightarrow  3y = x ^ {  \frac {20}{13} } = 3 (3x) ^ { \frac {2}{3} } "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\Rightarrow (3x) ^ {  \frac {20}{13} } = 3 ^ { 1+ \frac {20}{13} }  (3x) ^ { \frac {2}{3} } \quad \Rightarrow (3x) ^ {\frac {20}{13} - \frac {2}{3} } = 3 ^ {\frac {33}{13} } \quad  \Rightarrow  (3x) ^ {\frac {34}{39} } = 3 ^ {\frac {33}{13} } "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\Rightarrow (3x) ^ {\frac {34}{39} \times \frac {13}{33}  } = 3 \quad  \Rightarrow  (3x) ^ {\frac {34}{99} } = 3 \quad \Rightarrow \log_{3x} {3} = \frac {34}{99}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\Rightarrow  \log _{3x} { 3y } =  \log _{3x} { 3 }  + \log _{3x} { y } "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\quad \quad = \frac {34}{99} + \frac {2}{3} = \frac{100}{99} = \frac {a}{b}\quad \Rightarrow a+b = \boxed{199}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

title: 2015 Mock AIME I Problem 3: Intersection of Circles
body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Let "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"A,B,C"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" be points in the plane such that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"AB=25"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"AC=29"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\\angle BAC<90^\\circ"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":".  Semicircles with diameters "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\\overline{AB}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\\overline{AC}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" intersect at a point "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"P"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" with "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"AP=20"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":".  Find the maximum possible length of line segment "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\\overline{BC}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"First note that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\triangle APB"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is a "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"3-4-5"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" right triangle and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\triangle APC"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is a "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"20-21-29"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" right triangle."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Thus, we have "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\cos \angle BAP = \dfrac{20}{25}=\dfrac{4}{5}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\cos \angle PAC = \dfrac{20}{29}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Similarly, we have "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\sin \angle BAP = \dfrac{15}{25}=\dfrac{3}{5}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\sin \angle PAC = \dfrac{21}{29}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Applying the Law of Cosines on "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\angle BAC"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" gives us:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"BC=\sqrt{25^2+29^2-2\cdot25\cdot29\cdot\cos (\angle BAP+\angle PAC)}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"We also know that:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\cos (\angle BAP+\angle PAC)=\cos\angle BAP\cos\angle PAC - \sin \angle BAP \sin \angle PAC"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\qquad\qquad\qquad\qquad\quad\;\;=\dfrac{20}{25}\cdot\dfrac{20}{29}-\dfrac{15}{25}\cdot\dfrac{21}{29}=\dfrac{17}{145}."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Hence, we have "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"BC=\sqrt{25^2+29^2-2\cdot25\cdot29\cdot\dfrac{17}{145}}=\sqrt{1296}=\boxed{36}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

comments.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            Can't it be just sqrt(25^2 + 29^2) since, we know that BAC is a right triangle itself?

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}
